2. Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit on primary and secondary state and federal highways is:
3. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column4: keep more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.

column2: 4. If you meet a stopped school bus with the lights flashing and the signal arm extended, you should:
column4: watch for children and proceed at normal speed.
column6: proceed at 15 MPH or less, if no children are present.

column2: 5. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
6. Continuous hard braking on ice and snow often:
column4: causes the front wheels to lock.
column8: is the best option during winter.

column2: 7. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
8. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
9. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
column6: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column6: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right

column2: 11. If you have had three beers in the past hour, about how long will it take for all the alcohol to leave your blood stream?
12. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
13. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column6: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.

column2: 14. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
15. A defensive driver:
column4: knows when it is safe to pass other vehicles.
column6: considers what other drivers might do and is always prepared to act.
column8: never drives below the speed limit.

column2: 16. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
17. This road sign means the road you're driving on:
column4: turns sharply to the left and then right
column8: turns to the right and then the left

column2: 18. This sign means:
column4: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM
column6: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 19. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
column6: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
column8: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.

column2: 20. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column6: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.
column8: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.

column2: 21. A solid yellow line on your side of the center line means:
22. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
column6: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column8: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.

column2: 23. Drivers should use the turn signal ________ before making a turn.
24. If a vehicle is coming towards you at night with its high beams on, making it hard to see the road ahead, you should:
column4: look straight ahead towards the middle of the lane.
column6: look ahead towards the right edge of your lane.
column8: look ahead towards the left edge of your lane.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column4: You have the right of way

column2: 26. The octagonal shape is used:

column8: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.

30. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column6: enter the intersection and then stop.
column8: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.
